author: Scaly Soul
DragonNexus

text: @DragonNexus Maybe I am reading into this idea a bit too much, but I've found that concept to be in quite a few  Japanese-made RPGs that were made then. But now, the RPGs of today are just flurishing with great stories and personalities. Good examples that aren't Final Fantasy games would  be Skies of Arcadia and Lost Odyssey.
author: Scaly Soul

text: @DragonNexus Yeah, fundamentally.. You would never find a novel revolving around SF. The characters were really one-dimensional when it came to their own personal development story-wise.. But each one had thier own unique personality.. So with that being said, in in a sense, I imagine they made the characters as ambiguous as possible, including the main hero (who is usually always mute).. So that the player could relate whatever feelings and thoughts they had about the characters as a whole.
author: Scaly Soul
DragonNexus

author: Max20Characters

text:
That said, I absolutely love this song... so many memories of playing this game, so so many times. It's got such a great story, and the twists and turns are awesome. This song always reminds me specifically of every cool thing that ever happened in any town. The beginning when Bowie wakes up at home, going to school, buying weapons, finding Oddler, being shrunk down and finding the chess board world, the way that the towns people moved to the music...

God this was a great fucking game.
